    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    AbstractGenericRepository<T,ID>
    A generic repository for performing common database operations.
    AbstractItem
    An abstract class that implements the IItem interface and provides a base implementation for common functionality across all items in the game.
    AlarmClock
     
    AlarmEffect
    The AlarmEffect class represents an effect that wakes up the player from sleep when triggered, simulating the sound of an alarm in the game.
    BaseEntity
    Represents a base entity.
    BoxFactory
     
    Cake
     
    Chest
    Represents a chest in the game that contains a random item The chest can be opened by the player, and once opened, the item is added to the current room's inventory
    Command
    The Command enum represents the different commands that a player can execute in the game.
    CommandContext
    The CommandContext class represents the context of a command, which includes additional information such as the item name or direction associated with the command.
    CommandFactory
    The CommandFactory class is responsible for creating commands based on the command name and context.
    CommandParser
    The CommandParser class is responsible for parsing user input and determining the appropriate game command to execute.
    Config
    The Config class stores the configuration details for the game, including the paths to the dungeon CSV files.
    Config.SpawnRates
    Static nested class representing spawn rates for different difficulty levels.
    ConsoleInputHandler
    Handles console input from the user using a Scanner.
    ConsoleUI
     
    CustomConsoleHandler
    Custom console handler for the logger.
    CustomLogFormatter
    A custom log formatter for formatting log messages.
    CustomLogger
    A custom logger implementation using Java's built-in logging framework.
    CutieCat
    Represents a special trap: CutieCat, which immobilizes the player until it is fed.
    DatabaseConnection
    Handles the database connection lifecycle for the application.
    DatabaseInitializer
    Initializes the database schema.
    Difficulty
    Enum representing different difficulty levels in the game.
    Direction
     
    DropCommand
    The DropCommandclass implements the ICommand interface to drop an item from the player's inventory into the current room.
    Dungeon
    The Dungeon class represents a multi-level dungeon in the game.
    DungeonService
    DungeonService is responsible for initializing the dungeon from a CSV file, creating rooms, and setting adjacent room relationships.
    EatCakeEffect
    The EatCakeEffect class represents the effect of eating a cake in the game When applied, the player gains 3 power points, and a message is displayed
    EatSandwichEffect
    The EatSandwichEffect class represents the effect of eating a sandwich in the game.
    EscapeCommand
    The EscapeCommand class implements the ICommand interface to escape from a trap in the current room.
    EscapeEvent
    Represents an event triggered when a player attempts to escape from a trap This event contains the trap involved and the strategy used for escaping
    EventManager
    A singleton class that manages the registration and dispatching of events in the game It allows components to register as listeners for specific event types and dispatches events to the appropriate listeners when triggered
    Food
     
    FreezeSpell
     
    FreezeSpellEffect
    The FreezeSpellEffect class represents the effect of using a freeze spell When applied, it allows the player to escape from certain types of traps, specifically MadScientists and Trap, using the FreezeSpellStrategy
    FreezeSpellStrategy
    The FreezeSpellStrategy class represents a strategy for escaping traps by using a freeze spell
    Game
    The Game class serves as the central controller for the game.
    GameContext
    The GameContext class manages the current state of the game.
    GameNarrator
    GameNarrator class contains static methods to generate messages for various game events.
    Hammer
     
    HammerEffect
    The HammerEffect class represents the effect of using a hammer When applied, it allows the player to escape from traps of type Trap using the HammerStrategy
    HammerStrategy
    The HammerStrategy class represents a strategy for escaping traps by using a hammer
    HelpCommand
    The HelpCommand class implements the ICommand interface This command outputs a list of available commands, along with their descriptions and aliases, to guide the player on how to interact with the game.
    IBox
    Represents a chest in the game that can be opened by the player.
    ICommand
    The ICommand interface defines the structure for all command classes in the game.
    IEffect
    The IEffect interface represents an effect that can be applied within the game context.
    IEscapeStrategy
     
    IEvent
     
    IEventListener
     
    IGenericRepository<T,ID>
     
    IInputHandler
     
    IItem
    The interface for all items in the game.
    ILogger
     
    InventoryManager
    The InventoryManager class is responsible for managing the player's inventory.
    ItemFactory
    The ItemFactory class is responsible for creating instances of various items in the game.
    ITrap
    Interface for a trap in the game.
    LoggerFactory
     
    LookAroundCommand
    The LookAroundCommand class implements the ICommand interface and allows the player to "look around" in the current room.
    LosePointsStrategy
    The LosePointsStrategy class represents a strategy for escaping traps by losing a specified number of power points
    MadScientists
    Represents the "Mad Scientists" trap in the game The trap involves a group of scientists who trap the player by talking constantly about their experiments The player becomes stuck in the room until they use a specific strategy to escape
    Main
     
    Menu
    The main menu of the game.
    MimicChest
    Represents a mimic chest in the game that attacks the player when opened
    MoveCommand
    The MoveCommand class implements the ICommand interface and is responsible for moving the player in a specified direction This command is triggered when the player decides to move to a different room
    OpenChestCommand
     
    OpenEvent
    Represents an event that occurs when a box is opened.
    PickUpCommand
    The PickUpCommand class implements the ICommand interface and handles the action of picking up an item from the current room.
    Player
    The Player class represents the player in the game.
    PlayerEntity
    Represents a player in the game.
    PlayerRepository
    Repository for managing PlayerEntity objects in the database.
    Potion
     
    QuitCommand
    The QuitCommand class handles the action of quitting the game When executed, it stops the game loop and displays a quit message to the player
    Room
    Represents a room in the dungeon.
    RoomFactory
    Factory class responsible for creating rooms and setting adjacent rooms in a dungeon.
    RunHistoryEntity
    Represents a previous run of the game.
    RunHistoryRepository
    Repository for managing RunHistoryEntity objects in the database Handles CRUD operations
    Sandwich
     
    Sausage
     
    SausageEffect
    The SausageEffect class represents an effect that allows the player to use a sausage to escape a trap.
    SausageStrategy
     
    ShowInventoryCommand
    The ShowInventoryCommand class implements the ICommand interface and is responsible for displaying the player's current inventory.
    ShowMapCommand
    The ShowMapCommand class implements the ICommand interface and is responsible for displaying the map of the dungeon.
    ShowStatsCommand
    The ShowStatsCommand class implements the ICommand interface and is responsible for displaying the player's current statistics, such as power points and current room, in a nicely formatted output.
    SleepEffect
    The SleepEffect class represents an effect that causes the player to fall asleep When applied, this effect sets the player's sleep status to true, preventing them from performing actions
    Spanner
     
    SpannerEffect
    The SpannerEffect class represents an effect that allows the player to interact with chests in the room When applied, this effect opens a closed chest in the current room.
    Spell
     
    TeleportationEffect
    The TeleportationEffect class represents an effect that teleports the player to a random room within the current dungeon, excluding walls and the current room.
    TeleportationSpell
     
    Tool
     
    Trap
    Represents a generic trap in the game that can immobilize the player The trap can be escaped by using specific strategies or items
    TrapFactory
    A factory class responsible for creating traps in the game.
    UI
     
    UIManager
     
    UnknownCommand
     
    UseCommand
    The UseCommand class implements the ICommand interface and handles the use of an item from the player's inventory The command will search for an item by name, and if found, it will apply its effect If the item is consumable, it will be removed from the inventory after use
    WakeUpCommand
    The WakeUpCommand class implements the action of waking up the player If the player is asleep, it attempts to use an "alarm clock" item from the player's inventory If no alarm clock is available, the player wakes up by lossing power points
    XRayEffect
    The XRayEffect class represents an effect that allows the player to see into a random adjacent room without entering it.
